New Records: Golden State Warriors implemented a 12-man rotation, a new approach for the team
Stephen Curry played 25 minutes and nearly recorded a triple-double
Buddy Hield scored 22 points in 15 minutes off the bench
Jonathan Kuminga made his NBA debut and showed potential
Key Match Events: The Warriors dominated the Blazers with a strong performance in the middle quarters
The game turned into a blowout win for the Warriors
Golden State Warriors set a new record with 48 three-point attempts and made 20
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Kerr decided to start a bigger lineup with Jonathan Kuminga and Andrew Wiggins
Kerr emphasized the importance of defensive execution and offensive speed
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry praised the team's depth and locker room atmosphere
Jonathan Kuminga remained focused on his performance despite contract uncertainty
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 12-man rotation is a significant challenge for both players and coaches
The Warriors' ability to maintain a high volume of three-point shooting was notable
